data.title: The 40+ Best Movies About Talking Dogs
data.meta_description: The 40+ Best Movies About Talking Dogs, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: Homeward Bound: The Incredible Journey, Balto, Lady and the Tramp
data.text:
Voting Rules

Vote on your favorite movies about talking dogs or that predominately features a talking dog.

The fascination with our four-legged friends takes a whimsical twist in movies about talking dogs, a niche but beloved subgenre in the world of cinema. There's something undeniably engaging about hearing what's going on in the minds of man's best friend, and filmmakers have tapped into this curiosity, crafting films that give these loyal companions a voice of their own. Talking dog movies range from heartwarming tales that tug at the heartstrings to laugh-out-loud comedies that showcase the humorous potential of a chatting pooch.

Within this unique film category, we find an array of storylines that bring a fresh perspective to the bonds between humans and their pets, exploring themes of loyalty, adventure, and friendship through the eyes (and mouths) of dogs. From animated heroes on epic quests to live-action pups that unwittingly find themselves on wild escapades, these films have an undeniable charm that has captivated audiences across generations and demographics.

Join us as we fetch the cream of the crop, the top talking dog movies that have left their paw prints on cinematic history. Whether it's through the sophisticated gadgetry of voice-translating collars or the magic of storytelling that allows us to hear dogs' inner thoughts, these films assure us that if dogs could talk, they would have some incredible tales to tell.

Latest additions: Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed, Rover Dangerfield

Help shape these rankings by voting on this list of The 40+ Best Movies About Talking Dogs

1

15 VOTES

For Fans Of: Adventure, Drama, Family, Animals

Reasons to Watch if You're Interested in Talking Dogs: This 1993 family-friendly adventure elevates the concept of talking dogs with its seamless blend of realism and fantasy, as two canines - Golden Retriever Shadow and American Bulldog Chance - along with their feline companion Sassy, embark on a precarious journey through the Sierra Nevada mountains to reunite with their family. With exceptional voice acting by Don Ameche, Michael J. Fox, and Sally Field, this film brings both humor and poignancy to the anthropomorphized animals' interactions, drawing viewers into their world. Homeward Bound's heartening portrayal of loyalty and perseverance makes it an ideal choice for talking dog enthusiasts.

Embarking on a thrilling adventure in Homeward Bound: The Incredible Journey, three beloved pets take the lead. Shadow, a wise old golden retriever (voiced by Don Ameche), Sassy, a witty Himalayan cat (voiced by Sally Field), and Chance, a reckless American bulldog (voiced by Michael J. Fox), are left in the care of a family friend. When they mistakenly believe their owners have abandoned them, they set out across the rugged Sierra Nevada terrain to reunite with their family. Battling treacherous conditions and wild animals along the way, their determination is tested at every step. This heartwarming tale underscores the power of friendship and loyalty in this family-friendly adventure film.

Actors : Don Ameche, Michael J. Fox, Sally Field, Don Adler, Ed Bernard

Released : 1993

Directed by : Duwayne Dunham

2

6 VOTES

For Fans Of: Animation, Adventure, Drama, Family

Reasons to Watch if You're Interested in Talking Dogs: Based on the true story of a heroic sled dog named Balto during the 1925 serum run to Nome, Alaska, this 1995 animated classic features Kevin Bacon as the voice behind its titular character alongside an ensemble cast of anthropomorphized animals engaged in thrilling adventures amidst harsh winter conditions. While not technically classified as talking among humans, Balto's interactions with fellow canine and animal companions showcase bravery, loyalty, and teamwork in their quest to save lives. Fans of talking dogs seeking historical context with engaging storylines will appreciate this heartening tale of canine courage and determination.

In this animated feature, a deadly diphtheria epidemic strikes the remote town of Nome, Alaska. With the life-saving medicine located hundreds of miles away, the residents decide to send out a sled-dog team. Balto (Kevin Bacon) -- a half-wolf dog ignored by all except a goose, Boris (Bob Hoskins), and two polar bears -- is chosen to run but is disqualified by lead dog Steele (Jim Cummings). When the other dogs get lost in the snow, Balto risks his life to rescue them and deliver the medicine.

Actors : Miriam Margolyes, Lola Bates-Campbell, Kevin Bacon, Bob Hoskins, Bridget Fonda

Released : 1995

Directed by : Simon Wells

3

7 VOTES

For Fans Of: Animation, Romance, Family, Comedy

Reasons to Watch if You're Interested in Talking Dogs: This timeless 1955 Disney classic presents a romantic tale centered around two talking dogs from opposite sides of the tracks - pampered Cocker Spaniel Lady and streetwise mutt Tramp - as they navigate class differences and fall in love along the way. With its iconic spaghetti-sharing scene, charming animation, and memorable songs such as "Bella Notte," this film offers a captivating portrayal of anthropomorphized canines navigating complex emotions while staying true to their instincts. A must-see for fans of talking dogs who enjoy stories rich in romance and adventure.

This Disney animated classic follows a pampered cocker spaniel named Lady (Barbara Luddy) whose comfortable life slips away once her owners have a baby. When, after some tense circumstances, Lady finds herself on the loose and out on the street, she is befriended and protected by the tough stray mutt Tramp (Larry Roberts). A romance begins to blossom between the two dogs, but their many differences, along with more drama at Lady's household, threaten to keep them apart.

Actors : Peggy Lee, Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts, Bill Thompson, Bill Baucom

Released : 1955

Directed by : Clyde Geronimi, Wilfred Jackson, Hamilton Luske

4

12 VOTES

For Fans Of: Animation, Fantasy, Family, Adventure

Reasons to Watch if You're Interested in Talking Dogs: This 1989 animated classic centers around Charlie B. Barkin, a German Shepherd who returns from the afterlife with a newfound purpose - to protect an orphan girl named Anne-Marie from danger. Boasting memorable songs and captivating animation, this film showcases talking dogs inhabiting an imaginative parallel world while addressing themes such as redemption, compassion, and second chances. Fans of talking dogs will appreciate the lively characters and heartfelt storylines found within this enduring cinematic gem.

In the animated feature All Dogs Go to Heaven, Charlie B. Barkin (Burt Reynolds) is a rogue German Shepherd with a charming spirit. After being killed by his former friend and business partner, Carface Carruthers (Vic Tayback), Charlie finds himself in heaven. Yet, he yearns for a second chance at life. He returns to earth, befriends an orphan girl who can talk to animals, Anne-Marie (Judith Barsi), and embarks on a mission of redemption. This film, filled with whimsical songs and quirky characters, offers a unique perspective on the age-old debate of good versus evil.

Actors : Dom DeLuise, Burt Reynolds, Daryl Gilley, Candy Devine, Charles Nelson Reilly

Released : 1989

Directed by : Don Bluth

5

7 VOTES

For Fans Of: Animation, Family, Comedy, Adventure

Reasons to Watch if You're Interested in Talking Dogs: This vibrant 2016 animated film provides a glimpse into what pets get up to when their humans are away, featuring an ensemble cast of lovable and quirky animal characters - including talking dogs Max (voiced by Louis C.K.) and Duke (Eric Stonestreet) - who embark on a thrilling adventure through New York City. With witty dialogue and captivating animation, this movie brings anthropomorphized animals' interactions to life, offering both humor and excitement for viewers seeking films about talking dogs. The Secret Life of Pets showcases heartfelt friendships between animals while giving audiences a delightful look at the imagined inner lives of our beloved pets.

Max (Louis C.K.) is a spoiled terrier who enjoys a comfortable life in a New York building until his owner adopts Duke, a giant and unruly canine. During their walk outside, they encounter a group of ferocious alley cats and wind up in a truck that's bound for the pound. Luckily, a rebellious bunny named Snowball swoops in to save the doggy duo from captivity. In exchange, Snowball demands that Max and Duke join his gang of abandoned pets on a mission against the humans who've done them wrong.

Actors : Louis C.K., Eric Stonestreet, Kevin Hart, Ellie Kemper, Albert Brooks

Released : 2016

Directed by : Chris Renaud

6

12 VOTES

For Fans Of: Adventure, Family, Drama, Comedy

Reasons to Watch if You're Interested in Talking Dogs: This classic 1986 film showcases the bond between a talking dog named Otis (the pug) and his feline friend, Milo (the cat), as they embark on a heartwarming adventure through the picturesque Japanese countryside. The charming narrations by Dudley Moore bring these animal characters to life, making it an enthralling choice for those seeking films about talking dogs. Their camaraderie and courage in overcoming obstacles together make this movie an inspiring tale of friendship that transcends species.

A cat and a dog find perils and mates after straying from their farm in Japan. Narrated by Dudley Moore.

Actors : Ky√¥ko Koizumi

Released : 1986

Directed by : Masanori Hata
